DataElement.preferredName: Brain Or Cerebrospinal Fluid Or Leptomeninges Lymphomatous Involvement of Extranodal Site Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there was any extranodal lymphoma involvement of brain, cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), or leptomeninges.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brain Or Cerebrospinal Fluid Or Leptomeninges Lymphomatous Involvement of Extranodal Site Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater._A pathologic and/or clinical finding indicating the spread of a lymphomatous process to an anatomic site other than lymph nodes._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.
A pathologic and/or clinical finding indicating the spread of a lymphomatous process to an anatomic site other than lymph nodes.
